intro: Racosperma spondylophyllum, commonly known as the silky acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is known for its finely hairy foliage, which gives it its common name. It is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Racosperma spondylophyllum is used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can be grown as a decorative shrub.
